__label__fake The paper states in part: “Chloroquine is effective in preventing the spread of SARS CoV in cell culture. Favorable inhibition of virus spread was observed when the cells were either treated with chloroquine prior to or after SARS CoV infection. In addition, the indirect immunofluorescence assay described herein represents a simple and rapid method for screening SARS-CoV antiviral compounds.”
__label__fake The study adds that all experiments were conducted “extracellularly” -- in a controlled environment outside of a living organism, and not on humans or other animals.
__label__fake In response to the misleading posts, Dr. Eric Bergeron of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), who co-wrote the 2005 paper, said: "This is totally absurd."
__label__fake “This paper only shows that chloroquine works in cell culture experiments, later studies in mice suggested that chloroquine was not effective against SARS-CoV," he said in an email on August 5.
__label__fake “Our results published suggested that chloroquine should be considered in human trials but trials demonstrated that it is ineffective against SARS-CoV-2 (which causes COVID-19). This is very common, many drugs show efficacy in cell culture but no clinical benefit. This is what people should care about: no clinical benefit. We treated cells in culture not humans.”
__label__fake Fauci claim
__label__fake The 2005 paper was published in the Virology Journal, an “open access, peer reviewed journal that considers articles on all aspects of virology, including research on the viruses of animals, plants and microbes,” according to information on its website here.
__label__fake The Journal belongs to the UK for-profit science publisher BioMed Central Company, which is a part of the British-German academic publishing company Springer Nature. It is not associated with Dr. Fauci or the NIH as stated in the misleading claim.
__label__fake A spokesperson for NIAID told AFP in an email dated August 5: “Dr. Fauci has previously stated that there is a lack of good evidence from randomized placebo-controlled trials to indicate that hydroxychloroquine is an effective therapeutic for COVID-19. The 2005 paper you are referring to was a cell-culture experiment with a different virus than SARS-CoV-2, and the study was conducted by CDC investigators. Virology Journal is published by BMC, part of Springer-Nature.”
__label__fake Fauci has become a target of COVID-19 misinformation as the novel coronavirus continues to spread globally, AFP reported here.
__label__fake 'No cure'
__label__fake In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, the debate over hydroxychloroquine has become politically charged. Leaders including US President Donald Trump and some fellow US conservatives have voiced strong support for the drug as a treatment for the novel coronavirus, AFP reported here.
__label__fake As of August 7, 2020, the WHO states on its website that “there is currently no proof that hydroxychloroquine or any other drug can cure or prevent COVID-19” and that “the misuse of hydroxychloroquine can cause serious side effects and illness and even lead to death.” It also ruled out the use of HCQ a treatment for hospitalised COVID-19 patients since “hydroxychloroquine does not result in the reduction of mortality of hospitalised COVID-19 patients, when compared with standard of care,” according to this June 17 announcement.
__label__fake Similarly on June 15, the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA) revoked the emergency use authorization (EUA) to use HCQ and CQ to treat COVID-19. “We made this determination based on recent results from a large, randomized clinical trial in hospitalized patients that found these medicines showed no benefit for decreasing the likelihood of death or speeding recovery,” the FDA states here.
__label__fake AFP previously debunked false claims that HCQ can cure COVID-19 here and here.
__label__fake Follow us
__label__fake Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. All rights reserved. Users can access and consult this website and use the share features available for personal, private, and non-commercial purposes.  Any other use, in particular any reproduction, communication to the public or distribution of the content of this website, in whole or in part, for any other purpose and/or by any other means, without a specific licence agreement signed with AFP, is strictly prohibited.  The subject matter depicted or included via links within the Fact Checking content is provided to the extent necessary for correct understanding of the verification of the information concerned.  AFP has not obtained any rights from the authors or copyright owners of this third party content and shall incur no liability in this regard.  AFP and its logo are registered trademarks.
__label__fake The claims were published here on Instagram on August 3, 2020. The post has received more than 290 likes.
__label__fake The text in the image reads in part: “The Virology Journal - the official publication of Dr. Fauci's National Institutes of Health - published what is now a blockbuster article on August 22, 2005, under the heading - get ready for this - ‘Chloroquine is a potion of SARS coronavirus infection and spread.’
__label__fake “This means, of course, that Dr. Fauci has known for 15 years that chloroquine and its even milder hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) will not only treat a current case of coronavirus (‘therapeutic’) but prevent future cases ('prophylactic’). So HCQ functions as both a cure and a vaccine.”
__label__fake The caption of the Instagram post states: “ALL THOSE BLOCKING INFORMATION ON HCQ ARE COMMITTING GENOCIDE INCLUDING FAUCI, DAN ANDREWS AND THE AUSTRALIAN GOVERNMENT.”
__label__fake Dr. Anthony Fauci has been the director of National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) under the US Department of Health and Human Services’ National Institutes of Health (NIH) since 1984.
__label__fake Chloroquine (CQ) is a malaria and amebiasis drug. Hydroxychloroquine (HCQ), a less toxic metabolite of chloroquine, is used to treat rheumatic diseases, according to this 2020 study.
__label__fake The claims were also shared on Facebook here, here, here and here; on Twitter here, here, here and here; and on various websites here and here.
__label__fake The claims, however, are false.
__label__fake 2005 study
__label__fake The study cited in the misleading post is this 2005 paper titled “Chloroquine is a potent inhibitor of SARS coronavirus infection and spread”. It was published following the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), an infectious disease caused by a SARS-associated coronavirus, known as SARS-CoV.
__label__fake The paper states in part: “Chloroquine is effective in preventing the spread of SARS CoV in cell culture. Favorable inhibition of virus spread was observed when the cells were either treated with chloroquine prior to or after SARS CoV infection. In addition, the indirect immunofluorescence assay described herein represents a simple and rapid method for screening SARS-CoV antiviral compounds.”
__label__fake The study adds that all experiments were conducted “extracellularly” -- in a controlled environment outside of a living organism, and not on humans or other animals.
__label__fake In response to the misleading posts, Dr. Eric Bergeron of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), who co-wrote the 2005 paper, said: "This is totally absurd."
__label__fake “This paper only shows that chloroquine works in cell culture experiments, later studies in mice suggested that chloroquine was not effective against SARS-CoV," he said in an email on August 5.
__label__fake “Our results published suggested that chloroquine should be considered in human trials but trials demonstrated that it is ineffective against SARS-CoV-2 (which causes COVID-19). This is very common, many drugs show efficacy in cell culture but no clinical benefit. This is what people should care about: no clinical benefit. We treated cells in culture not humans.”
__label__fake Fauci claim
__label__fake The 2005 paper was published in the Virology Journal, an “open access, peer reviewed journal that considers articles on all aspects of virology, including research on the viruses of animals, plants and microbes,” according to information on its website here.
__label__fake The Journal belongs to the UK for-profit science publisher BioMed Central Company, which is a part of the British-German academic publishing company Springer Nature. It is not associated with Dr. Fauci or the NIH as stated in the misleading claim.
__label__fake A spokesperson for NIAID told AFP in an email dated August 5: “Dr. Fauci has previously stated that there is a lack of good evidence from randomized placebo-controlled trials to indicate that hydroxychloroquine is an effective therapeutic for COVID-19. The 2005 paper you are referring to was a cell-culture experiment with a different virus than SARS-CoV-2, and the study was conducted by CDC investigators. Virology Journal is published by BMC, part of Springer-Nature.”
__label__fake Fauci has become a target of COVID-19 misinformation as the novel coronavirus continues to spread globally, AFP reported here.
__label__fake 'No cure'
__label__fake In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, the debate over hydroxychloroquine has become politically charged. Leaders including US President Donald Trump and some fellow US conservatives have voiced strong support for the drug as a treatment for the novel coronavirus, AFP reported here.
__label__fake As of August 7, 2020, the WHO states on its website that “there is currently no proof that hydroxychloroquine or any other drug can cure or prevent COVID-19” and that “the misuse of hydroxychloroquine can cause serious side effects and illness and even lead to death.” It also ruled out the use of HCQ a treatment for hospitalised COVID-19 patients since “hydroxychloroquine does not result in the reduction of mortality of hospitalised COVID-19 patients, when compared with standard of care,” according to this June 17 announcement.
__label__fake Similarly on June 15, the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA) revoked the emergency use authorization (EUA) to use HCQ and CQ to treat COVID-19. “We made this determination based on recent results from a large, randomized clinical trial in hospitalized patients that found these medicines showed no benefit for decreasing the likelihood of death or speeding recovery,” the FDA states here.
__label__fake AFP previously debunked false claims that HCQ can cure COVID-19 here and here.

__label__fake 'No cure'

The 2005 paper you are referring to was a cell-culture experiment with a different virus than SARS-CoV-2, and the study was conducted by CDC investigators. Virology Journal is published by BMC, part of Springer-Nature.”
__label__fake Fauci has become a target of COVID-19 misinformation as the novel coronavirus continues to spread globally, AFP reported here.
__label__fake 'No cure'
__label__fake In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, the debate over hydroxychloroquine has become politically charged. Leaders including US President Donald Trump and some fellow US conservatives have voiced strong support for the drug as a treatment for the novel coronavirus, AFP reported here.
__label__fake As of August 7, 2020, the WHO states on its website that “there is currently no proof that hydroxychloroquine or any other drug can cure or prevent COVID-19” and that “the misuse of hydroxychloroquine can cause serious side effects and illness and even lead to death.” It also ruled out the use of HCQ a treatment for hospitalised COVID-19 patients since “hydroxychloroquine does not result in the reduction of mortality of hospitalised COVID-19 patients, when compared with standard of care,” according to this June 17 announcement.
__label__fake Similarly on June 15, the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA) revoked the emergency use authorization (EUA) to use HCQ and CQ to treat COVID-19. “We made this determination based on recent results from a large, randomized clinical trial in hospitalized patients that found these medicines showed no benefit for decreasing the likelihood of death or speeding recovery,” the FDA states here.
__label__fake AFP previously debunked false claims that HCQ can cure COVID-19 here and here.
__label__fake Follow us

Any other use, in particular any reproduction, communication to the public or distribution of the content of this website, in whole or in part, for any other purpose and/or by any other means, without a specific licence agreement signed with AFP, is strictly prohibited.  The subject matter depicted or included via links within the Fact Checking content is provided to the extent necessary for correct understanding of the verification of the information concerned.  AFP has not obtained any rights from the authors or copyright owners of this third party content and shall incur no liability in this regard.  AFP and its logo are registered trademarks.
__label__fake Las informaciones falsas se comparten en Facebook y Whatsapp. Fuente: Reproducción.
__label__fake ‌‌
__label__fake ‌
__label__fake ‌
__label__fake Es falso que los cuerpos de las personas que mueren a causa del nuevo coronavirus no se le entregan a los familiares, como señalan erróneamente varias publicaciones e imágenes que circulan en redes sociales como Facebook y WhatsApp.
__label__fake Dichos mensajes aseguran que si alguien fallece por covid-19 a la familia “solo se le informará que está muerto y el Estado pensará en la eliminación del cuerpo”.
__label__fake Lo cierto es que, según el lineamiento general para el manejo de los cadáveres infectados de covid-19, desarrollado por el Organismo de Investigación Judicial (OIJ) y el Ministerio de Salud, después de realizada la autopsia el cadáver se le entrega en una bolsa sellada a los familiares o a la empresa funeraria.
__label__fake Luego de la entrega se debe realizar el siguiente manejo:
__label__fake 1- Tras la correcta introducción del cadáver, desinfección y sellado de la bolsa impermeable, la manipulación exterior de esta o del ataúd que la contenga no implica riesgos.
__label__fake 2- No se debe realizar apertura de la bolsa para limpieza, preparación o embalsamamiento del cadáver. La bolsa impermeable que contiene el cadáver puede introducirse en un féretro normal, sin que sean precisas precauciones especiales.
__label__fake 3- Se puede ofrecer servicio de velación para el fallecido, pero este será con el ataúd cerrado, con el cadáver introducido en la bolsa impermeable y con las precauciones detalladas anteriormente.
__label__fake 4- El destino final puede ser entierro o incineración, en las condiciones habituales.
__label__fake 5- Las cenizas pueden ser objeto de manipulación sin que supongan ningún riesgo.
__label__fake LEA MÁS: #NoComaCuento: Supuestos bonos de ONU, OMS y Gobierno por covid-19 son estafas
__label__fake Esta información forma parte del proyecto #NoComaCuento, una iniciativa de La Nación que busca analizar la veracidad de la información que circula en redes sociales. Usted puede formar parte de este proyecto enviándonos información que le parezca falsa o poco confiable al WhatsApp 6420-7160 o al correo nocomacuento@nacion.com.
__label__fake También puede recibir nuestras publicaciones directamente en su celular uniéndose a este grupo de WhatsApp o al bot de Telegram.
__label__fake En beneficio de la transparencia y para evitar distorsiones del debate público por medios informáticos o aprovechando el anonimato, la sección de comentarios está reservada para nuestros suscriptores para comentar sobre el contenido de los artículos, no sobre los autores. El nombre completo y número de cédula del suscriptor aparecerá automáticamente con el comentario.
__label__fake © 2024 Todos los derechos reservados, cualquier uso requiere autorización expresa y por escrito de Grupo Nación GN S.A.
__label__fake © 2024 Todos los derechos reservados, cualquier uso requiere autorización expresa y por escrito de Grupo Nación GN S.A.
__label__fake Miembro del Grupo de Diarios América (GDA)
__label__fake Сейчас
__label__fake +11˚C
__label__fake Сейчас в Санкт-Петербурге
__label__fake Пасмурно, Без осадков
__label__fake Ощущается как 9
__label__fake 1 м/с, сев
__label__fake 767мм
__label__fake 51%
__label__fake Пробки
__label__fake 2/10
__label__fake Коронавирус стремительно шагает по планете - по крайней мере, такое впечатление может сложиться, если почитать новости или полистать анонимные Telegram-каналы. Информации о заболевании настолько много, что абсолютно непонятно, что из этого правда, а что - обман, чтобы набрать лайки и репосты. “Фонтанка” попыталась разобраться, где кончается истина и начинаются мифы.
__label__fake В некоторых Telegram-каналах распространяется странное видео, в подписи к которому говорится, что тела жертв коронавируса якобы будут сжигать незамедлительно и едва ли не на месте – никаких похорон. Telegram-блогеры заявляют, что таково распоряжение комиссии здравоохранения Китая.
__label__fake Но ничего подобного на кадрах нет – оператор показывает, как где-то далеко внизу что-то горит, а вокруг суетятся и толпятся люди. Трупы ли там пылают, или это просто пожар в местном баре – неизвестно. Больше всего ролик похож на съемки беспорядков в Гонконге, но достоверно установить его происхождение не удалось. Полицейских или военных в кадре также не замечено – а ведь наверняка профилактическое сжигание должно было бы как-то контролироваться. Что до распоряжения комиссии здравоохранения, то об этом пишет лишь ряд сомнительных сайтов, ссылаясь на газету "Жэньминь Жибао" – известное китайское издание, у которого есть сайт и на русском языке. На самом сайте, однако, информация подается несколько иначе - в частности, говорится, что тела будут сжигаться в специальных крематориях «недалеко от места кончины», а уж никак не на улицах.
__label__fake По данным ВОЗ, в настоящее время коронавирусом заражены 14 557 человек. Из них 14 411 – в Китае. За пределами страны зафиксировано 146 подтвержденных случаев заражения более чем в 20 странах.
__label__fake Разумеется, расовая принадлежность заболевших и погибших не уточняется, но география распространения коронавируса обширна и вышла уже далеко за пределы Китая – как пел Высоцкий, «ширится, растёт заболевание». Следить за этим можно практически в прямом эфире на карте американского Университета имени Джона Хопкинса.
__label__fake В настоящее время нет никаких данных о том, что коронавирус косит только китайцев или только азиатов. Так что даже голубоглазым славянам с косой саженью в плечах стоит поберечься. По крайней мере, недавно главный санитарный врач России Анна Попова заявляла, что среди заразившихся есть не только китайцы. По словам Поповой, среди заболевших есть люди из европейских стран и США, «граждане и национальности, и расы совершенно другой».
__label__fake Также Попова высказывала предположение, что коронавирус может быть особенно опасен для пожилых людей. Главный санитарный врач страны рекомендовала мыть руки и при первых же симптомах обратиться к врачу.
__label__fake В России на данный момент всего 2 подтвержденных случая заражения коронавирусом – это граждане Китая, обнаруженные в Тюменской области и Забайкальском крае.
__label__fake В России любят китайского торгового агрегатора, а потому шутка про то, как страшно нынче забирать вожделенные посылки, быстро стала народным мемом. Но не для всех – некоторые всерьез опасаются, что вирус может притаиться на чехлах для смартфона или любой другой ожидаемой покупке. По словам завкафедрой инфекционных болезней РНИМУ имени Пирогова Владимира Никифорова, коронавирус крайне нестойкий и заразиться им через посылку никак невозможно. Ему в противовес выступает мнение руководителя лаборатории геномной инженерии МФТИ Павла Волчкова. Он полагает, что коронавирус не умирает в результате заморозки и не боится путешествовать. Так что вероятность заболеть хоть и мизерная, но есть.
__label__fake Вспышка коронавируса и видеоигры – как это связано? Очень просто – есть такая игра, Plague Inc, которая является буквально симулятором пандемии. Задача игрока – выкосить все население виртуальной Земли, что не так просто. Вскоре после того, как о коронавирусе узнали все, популярность Plague Inc резко возросла во всем мире – например, игра возглавила топ платных игр в чарте App Store. А заодно появился мем про Гренландию – в игре этот остров «захватить» эпидемией крайне сложно. Оно и понятно – там холодно, остров почти не взаимодействует с другими странами, а значит, бояться чихающих особо не стоит.
__label__fake 2020 год.		Весь мир: Ааааа, коронавирус, мы все умрём...		Гренландия: pic.twitter.com/zZTWwnzrAC
__label__fake Гренландия:живет себе спокойно.		Весь остальной мир уже зараженный коронавирусом: pic.twitter.com/oSejs0GyJM
__label__fake Все это пока соответствует реальности – на острове не зафиксировано ни одного заболевшего, а датчане (Гренландия входит в состав Датского королевства) пока что только шутят над болезнью. Например, газета Jyllands-Posten опубликовала карикатуру, на которую очень обиделась китайская сторона – дескать, нарушение норм этики.
__label__fake Avisledere: Alvorligt at Kina vil kontrollere danske medier https://t.co/MqHqQL2c1y pic.twitter.com/Hsofa1EmRo
__label__fake Впрочем, кольцо вокруг Гренландии уже опасно сжимается – подтвержденные случаи заболевания коронавирусом есть и в Европе, и в Канаде. Но если в видеоигры вы не игрок, можно развлечься и в реальности. «Фонтанке» рассказали, что в петербургских школах дети реформировали догонялки, переиначив их под актуальную новостную повестку. Теперь ребятишки играют «в коронавирус» – кого забашили, тот «заражен». В частности, такое происходит в одной из школ Центрального района.
__label__fake Отдельная тема для дискуссий – причины коронавируса и вообще все, что так или иначе связано с едой. Вспоминаем – нулевой пациент был зафиксирован 31 декабря в городе Ухань. Вскоре в Интернете появилась информация, что источником коронавируса стали змеи, которых китайцы едят. Потом коллективное бессознательное передумало – виновником инфекции назвали летучих мышей – да, да, их китайские гурманы тоже жалуют.
__label__fake Интернет тут же бросился рассматривать фотографии китайских блюд из мышей, змей, собак и прочих милых существ. Однако достоверных данных о том, откуда взялся 2019-ncov, нет. Все, что имеется, – это подозрения, что первоисточником может быть рынок морепродуктов в Ухане. Но опять же никакой конкретики, в том числе и потому, что вирус передается воздушно-капельным путем, а не через желудок и пищу.
__label__fake По этой же причине не стоит поддаваться панике в чатах и бояться, например, бананов. Нет никаких оснований полагать, что этот (или любой другой) фрукт может нести в себе угрозу.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Увидели опечатку? Выделите фрагмент и нажмите Ctrl+Enter
__label__fake Отправьте свою новость в редакцию, расскажите о проблеме или подкиньте тему для публикации. Сюда же загружайте ваше видео и фото.
__label__fake Контактные данные для Роскомнадзора и государственных органов
__label__fake «Фонтанка» — петербургское сетевое издание, где можно найти не только новости Петербурга, но и последние новости дня, и все важное и интересное, что происходит в России и в мире. Здесь вы отыщете наиболее значимые происшествия, новости Санкт-Петербурга, последние новости бизнеса, а также события в обществе, культуре, искусстве. Политика и власть, бизнес и недвижимость, дороги и автомобили, финансы и работа, город и развлечения — вот только некоторые из тем, которые освещает ведущее петербургское сетевое общественно-политическое издание. Санкт-Петербург читает «Фонтанку»! Наша аудитория — лидеры бизнеса и политики, чиновники, десятки тысяч горожан.
__label__fake © 2000-2024 Фонтанка.РуСвидетельство Роскомнадзора ЭЛ № ФС 77-66333 от 14.07.2016
__label__fake Разработка — ООО «Интернет Технологии»

__label__fake Avisledere: Alvorligt at Kina vil kontrollere danske medier https://t.co/MqHqQL2c1y pic.twitter.com/Hsofa1EmRo
__label__fake Впрочем, кольцо вокруг Гренландии уже опасно сжимается – подтвержденные случаи заболевания коронавирусом есть и в Европе, и в Канаде. Но если в видеоигры вы не игрок, можно развлечься и в реальности. «Фонтанке» рассказали, что в петербургских школах дети реформировали догонялки, переиначив их под актуальную новостную повестку. Теперь ребятишки играют «в коронавирус» – кого забашили, тот «заражен». В частности, такое происходит в одной из школ Центрального района.
__label__fake Отдельная тема для дискуссий – причины коронавируса и вообще все, что так или иначе связано с едой. Вспоминаем – нулевой пациент был зафиксирован 31 декабря в городе Ухань. Вскоре в Интернете появилась информация, что источником коронавируса стали змеи, которых китайцы едят. Потом коллективное бессознательное передумало – виновником инфекции назвали летучих мышей – да, да, их китайские гурманы тоже жалуют.
__label__fake Интернет тут же бросился рассматривать фотографии китайских блюд из мышей, змей, собак и прочих милых существ. Однако достоверных данных о том, откуда взялся 2019-ncov, нет. Все, что имеется, – это подозрения, что первоисточником может быть рынок морепродуктов в Ухане. Но опять же никакой конкретики, в том числе и потому, что вирус передается воздушно-капельным путем, а не через желудок и пищу.
__label__fake По этой же причине не стоит поддаваться панике в чатах и бояться, например, бананов. Нет никаких оснований полагать, что этот (или любой другой) фрукт может нести в себе угрозу.
__label__fake

__label__fake Отправьте свою новость в редакцию, расскажите о проблеме или подкиньте тему для публикации. Сюда же загружайте ваше видео и фото.
__label__fake Контактные данные для Роскомнадзора и государственных органов
__label__fake «Фонтанка» — петербургское сетевое издание, где можно найти не только новости Петербурга, но и последние новости дня, и все важное и интересное, что происходит в России и в мире. Здесь вы отыщете наиболее значимые происшествия, новости Санкт-Петербурга, последние новости бизнеса, а также события в обществе, культуре, искусстве. Политика и власть, бизнес и недвижимость, дороги и автомобили, финансы и работа, город и развлечения — вот только некоторые из тем, которые освещает ведущее петербургское сетевое общественно-политическое издание. Санкт-Петербург читает «Фонтанку»! Наша аудитория — лидеры бизнеса и политики, чиновники, десятки тысяч горожан.
__label__fake © 2000-2024 Фонтанка.РуСвидетельство Роскомнадзора ЭЛ № ФС 77-66333 от 14.07.2016
__label__fake Разработка — ООО «Интернет Технологии»
__label__fake Según el autor de la publicación viral, durante el brote del nuevo coronavirus en Italia “colapsa el sistema de salud y tienen que comenzar a determinar humanamente a quien atienden”. La afirmación está acompañada de una foto de varios hombres vestidos con enterizos, máscaras y gafas protectoras que llevan un cuerpo cubierto en una camilla. Un texto sobre la imagen asegura que ese país registró “368 muertes por coronavirus en las últimas 24 horas”.
__label__fake La cifra de muertos en Italia era cierta: el 15 de marzo, Italia informó de 368 nuevas muertes de personas con coronavirus en un lapso de 24 horas.
__label__fake Asimismo, se dice que los doctores en el norte de ese país se han visto obligados a escoger a qué pacientes salvar entre los contagiados. La AFP reportó testimonios en ese sentido de médicos del norte de Italia, la zona en que comenzó a propagarse el nuevo coronavirus a finales de febrero en el país.
__label__fake La imagen, con el mismo texto, fue divulgada por varias cuentas de Facebook, también en fechas posteriores (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) y siendo compartida igualmente miles de veces.
__label__fake Sin embargo, la fotografía no corresponde a la situación en Italia, sino que fue tomada en Irán durante el entierro de Fatemeh Rahbar, una diputada iraní que falleció el 7 de marzo, luego de contagiarse con el virus.
__label__fake Una búsqueda inversa de la imagen en Google llevó al equipo de AFP Factual a una nota del portal thisismoney.co.uk que incluye la foto viral.
__label__fake Según el pie de foto el registro fue tomado el 8 de marzo de 2020 en el cementerio Behesht-e-Zahra, a las afueras de Teherán, durante el entierro de Fatemeh Rahbar, quien se había contagiado del nuevo coronavirus y falleció el día anterior. El portal le atribuye la foto a Mehdi Khanlari, de la agencia de noticias iraní Fars, que la difunde a través de la agencia estadounidense Associated Press (AP). En efecto, en la esquina inferior izquierda de la fotografía incluída en las publicaciones virales puede verse una marca de agua de Fars.
__label__fake La foto, acompañada de la misma leyenda, también se encuentra en el portal de la AP.
__label__fake Con 6.007 muertos, Italia es, al 24 de marzo, el país con más fallecidos con el nuevo coronavirus. Lo siguen China continental, donde han muerto 3.277 personas; España, con 2.696 fallecidos; e Irán, con 1.934 muertes, según un balance realizado por la AFP en base a fuentes oficiales.
__label__fake En conclusión, la imagen que acompaña a un mensaje sobre el impacto del nuevo coronavirus en Italia no corresponde al país europeo, sino al entierro de una diputada en Irán.
__label__fake Síganos

__label__fake Sayyara Mammadova
__label__fake Tv100, T24,Kıbrıs Postası'nın yanı sıra Independent, Forbes gibi yabancı kaynaklarda “seks yasağı” başlığı ile haberleştirilen bir iddiaya göre, Britanya’da aynı evde yaşamayan kişilerin cinsel ilişkiye girmesi yasaklandı. İddiaya göre Britanya hükümeti aynı evde yaşamayanların cinsel ilişkiye girmesini “yasa dışı” olarak kabul edeceğini açıkladı.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Ancak iddia doğru değil. Britanya hükümeti böyle bir yasak getirmedi. Karantina önlemlerini düzenleyen mevcut yasaya eklenen maddelerde, cinsel ilişkiyle ilgili bir hüküm yer almıyor.
__label__fake Ülkede Covid-19 ile mücadele kapsamında uygulanan “The Health Protection” yasasına 1 Haziran 2020’den sonra geçerli olmak üzere eklemeler yapıldığı doğru. Bu ek maddelerle, pandemi dönemine has bazı kısıtlamalar getirildi. Bu eklemelerden iddia ile ilgili olanı, 3/a maddesi.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Ancak bu bölümde cinsel ilişki ile ilgili bir ifade yok. İlgili kısıtlama “İki veya daha fazla kişinin birbirleriyle aynı evde sosyal etkileşime girmeleri yahut başka herhangi bir faaliyette bulunmaları” diye çevrilebilir.
__label__fake Düzenleme maddeleri, ayrı evlerde yaşayan iki veya daha fazla kişinin, aynı iç mekanda buluşup fiziki mesafelerini kaybetmelerini engellemek için eklenmiş. Yani Covid-19 döneminde, normalde farklı evlerde yaşayanların, aynı evde buluşması genel olarak yasaklanıyor. Yasa cinsel ilişkiye girip girmemeleriyle ilgilenmiyor.
__label__fake Salgına karşı dünyada birçok hükümet benzer fiziki mesafe kuralları uygulamaya başladı. Britanya hükümetinin resmi Twitter sayfasında da, iki metre mesafeyi korumanın önemine dönük paylaşımlar yapıldı. Bu mesafeyi korumak şartıyla, dış mekanlarda altı kişinin bir araya gelmesinde yasal bir mahsur yok. Yetkililer de insanları evde buluşmamaya özendiriyor.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Sonuç olarak Britanya hükümeti aynı evde yaşamayanların cinsel ilişkiye girmelerini yasaklamadı, ilgili kuralların amacı fiziki mesafe ilkesine uyulmasını yasal güvence altına almak. Ayrıca uygulama sadece pandemi dönemini kapsıyor. İddiayı yanlış bilginin en yaygın yedi türünden bağlamdan koparma olarak nitelendirebiliriz.
__label__fake Yanlış bilgi hızla yayılırken gerçeklere ulaşmak çok daha önemli
__label__fake Teyitçilik araçlarını öğrenmek içinPürmerak Kulübü’ne katılın
__label__fake Teyit Medya A.Ş. © 2016-2024
__label__fake Bireysel eğitim almak istiyorum.
__label__fake Teyit'in uzmanlarından alacağınız eğitimlerle bilgi karmaşasında doğruları kolaylıkla ayırt edin. Geleceğin dünyası için en önemli becerileri edinin. İstanbul Bilgi Üniversitesi onaylı, sertifikalı teyitçi olun.
__label__fake Kurumsal eğitim almak istiyorum.
__label__fake Kurumsal eğitimlerimiz için [email protected] hesabına taleplerinizi iletebilirsiniz.
__label__fake Haftanın doğruları ve yanlışları, doğrulama yöntemleri ve Teyit mutfağından duyurular her Cuma posta kutunda.
__label__fake Yanlış bilgi sorunuyla mücadele eden, bilgi ekosistemini iyileştirmeyi amaçlayan ve sosyal etki hedefiyle hareket eden bir ekibin parçası mı olmak istiyorsun?
__label__fake Teyit’e başvurmanın tam sırası! Aşağıda belirttiğimiz nitelikleri karşıladığını düşünüyorsan gecikmeden başvur. Pozisyon dolana kadar başvuru almaya devam edeceğiz.

__label__fake دي مش عربية اسعاف، دي عربية مفرقعات الناس اتجمعت حواليها بتحتفل بظابط المفرقعات بعد تفكيك قنبلة في طنطا سنة 2017.
__label__fake 
__label__fake 
__label__fake كلمات البحثاسعاف طنطا فيروس قنبلة كورونا مفرقعات
__label__fake Condividono una circolare del Ministero della Salute che, se letta veramente, smentisce la narrativa del divieto
__label__fake In questi giorni circolano gli screenshot di una circolare del Ministero della Salute in merito alle autopsie sui morti Covid-19. Secondo la narrativa proposta, il Governo avrebbe vietato di effettuarle per insabbiare «la verità sul Coronavirus». Una vecchia conoscenza, Cesare Sacchetti, propone su Twitter ciò che altri avevano già affermato prima di lui diffondendo l’alone del complotto:
__label__fake Ecco la circolare dove il Ministero della Sanità ordinava di non fare le autopsie sui morti con Covid. Se si fossero fatte le autopsie, terapie sbagliate sarebbero state evitate e molte persone non sarebbero morte. Non volevano far venire fuori la verità. Volevano insabbiarla.
__label__fake A parte citare il «Ministero della Sanità» anziché il più corretto «Ministero della Salute» (è pure scritto nell’intestazione del documento), non vi è alcun divieto di praticare le autopsie sui morti Covid-19. Si tratta di pura disinformazione basata sull’errata comprensione del testo, o della distorsione dello stesso per sostenere l’ennesima teoria di complotto.
__label__fake La circolare in questione è la n. 15280 del 2 maggio 2020 – «Oggetto: Indicazioni emergenziali connesse ad epidemia COVID-19 riguardanti il settore funebre, cimiteriale e di cremazione» – dove leggiamo a pagina 4 le indicazioni sugli esami autoptici e riscontri diagnostici (capitolo C):
__label__fake 1- Per l’intero periodo della fase emergenziale non si dovrebbe procedere all’esecuzione di autopsie o riscontri diagnostici nei casi conclamati di COVID-19, sia se deceduti in corso di ricovero presso un reparto ospedaliero sia se deceduti presso il proprio domicilio.
__label__fake Nella lingua italiana «non si dovrebbe» non significa «è vietato» o «è proibito». Infatti, il capitolo prosegue con il punto 2:
__label__fake 2- L’Autorità Giudiziaria potrà valutare, nella propria autonomia, la possibilità di limitare l’accertamento alla sola ispezione esterna del cadavere in tutti i casi in cui l’autopsia non sia strettamente necessaria. Analogamente le Direzioni sanitarie di ciascuna regione daranno indicazioni finalizzate a limitare l’esecuzione dei riscontri diagnostici ai soli casi volti alla diagnosi di causa del decesso, limitando allo stretto necessario quelli da eseguire per motivi di studio e approfondimento.
__label__fake Basta leggere questo secondo punto per comprendere che le Direzioni sanitarie possono comunque eseguire riscontri diagnostici ai soli casi volti alla diagnosi di causa del decesso. Passiamo al punto 3:
__label__fake 3- In caso di esecuzione di esame autoptico o riscontro diagnostico, oltre ad una attenta valutazione preventiva dei rischi e dei vantaggi connessi a tale procedura, devono essere adottate tutte le precauzioni seguite durante l’assistenza del malato. Le autopsie e i riscontri possono essere effettuate solo in quelle sale settorie che garantiscano condizioni di massima sicurezza e protezione infettivologica per operatori ed ambienti di lavoro: sale BSL3, ovvero con adeguato sistema di aerazione, cioè un sistema con minimo di 6 e un massimo di 12 ricambi aria per ora, pressione negativa rispetto alle aree adiacenti, e fuoriuscita di aria direttamente all’esterno della struttura stessa o attraverso filtri HEPA, se l’aria ricircola. Oltre agli indumenti protettivi e all’impiego dei DPI, l’anatomo patologo e tutto il personale presente in sala autoptica indosseranno un doppio paio di guanti in lattice, con interposto un paio di guanti antitaglio.
__label__fake Per concludere, dopo una sfilza di indicazioni riguardanti la sicurezza del personale e non solo, al punto 8 leggiamo come dovrebbe essere trattata la sala settoria al termine dell’autopsia:
__label__fake 8- Al termine dell’autopsia o del riscontro diagnostico, la sala settoria deve essere accuratamente lavata con soluzione di ipoclorito di sodio o di fenolo.
__label__fake Quindi, ancora una volta, le autopsie si possono effettuare per i morti Covid-19 a patto che vi siano le condizioni per farlo in sicurezza. Condizioni che erano già note agli addetti ai lavori, anche in merito alle difficoltà in alcune zone in cui non sono presenti sale BSL3. Ecco quanto riportato in un articolo del 10 aprile 2020:
__label__fake CATANIA – Non ci sono sale autoptiche a Catania che hanno i requisiti previsti dal ministero della Salute per poter eseguire esami sui pazienti deceduti per Covid-19. E la situazione purtroppo non è migliore nel resto del Paese. La denuncia parte dalla Società Italiana Medici Legali e Assicurativi (Simla), il cui segretario è il medico catanese Lucio Di Mauro. Una fotografia scattata con molta chiarezza dall’ente che sta pressando il ministro Speranza su due fronti: uno sull’oggettiva mancanza di tutele nei confronti dei professionisti che operano nel settore e dall’altra la necessità di dotare il sistema sanitario italiano di locali idonei a poter effettuare le autopsie.
__label__fake Corretto! Simla, la Società Italiana Medici Legali e Assicurativi, aveva denunciato attraverso il proprio sito il fatto che molte sale autoptiche non risultano essere adeguate allo svolgimento delle autopsie in sicurezza.
__label__fake Sostenere che il Ministero della Salute o il Governo vietino di effettuare le autopsie sui morti Covid-19 risulta completamente falso. Il Ministero si è limitato a fornire le indicazioni su come le autopsie andrebbero fatte in sicurezza, soprattutto di fronte a un virus che fin dagli inizi non si conosceva granché. Un altro fatto riguarda il problema degli ambienti di lavoro adatti per effettuarle, un’informazione che di fatto smentisce la narrativa del divieto.
__label__fake Open.online is working with the CoronaVirusFacts/DatosCoronaVirus Alliance, a coalition of more than 100 fact-checkers who are fighting misinformation related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more about the alliance here (in English)
__label__fake 
__label__fake Open Impresa Sociale Srl
__label__fake Fondato da Enrico Mentana
__label__fake 
__label__fake Condividono una circolare del Ministero della Salute che, se letta veramente, smentisce la narrativa del divieto
__label__fake In questi giorni circolano gli screenshot di una circolare del Ministero della Salute in merito alle autopsie sui morti Covid-19. Secondo la narrativa proposta, il Governo avrebbe vietato di effettuarle per insabbiare «la verità sul Coronavirus». Una vecchia conoscenza, Cesare Sacchetti, propone su Twitter ciò che altri avevano già affermato prima di lui diffondendo l’alone del complotto:
__label__fake Ecco la circolare dove il Ministero della Sanità ordinava di non fare le autopsie sui morti con Covid. Se si fossero fatte le autopsie, terapie sbagliate sarebbero state evitate e molte persone non sarebbero morte. Non volevano far venire fuori la verità. Volevano insabbiarla.
__label__fake A parte citare il «Ministero della Sanità» anziché il più corretto «Ministero della Salute» (è pure scritto nell’intestazione del documento), non vi è alcun divieto di praticare le autopsie sui morti Covid-19. Si tratta di pura disinformazione basata sull’errata comprensione del testo, o della distorsione dello stesso per sostenere l’ennesima teoria di complotto.
__label__fake La circolare in questione è la n. 15280 del 2 maggio 2020 – «Oggetto: Indicazioni emergenziali connesse ad epidemia COVID-19 riguardanti il settore funebre, cimiteriale e di cremazione» – dove leggiamo a pagina 4 le indicazioni sugli esami autoptici e riscontri diagnostici (capitolo C):
__label__fake 1- Per l’intero periodo della fase emergenziale non si dovrebbe procedere all’esecuzione di autopsie o riscontri diagnostici nei casi conclamati di COVID-19, sia se deceduti in corso di ricovero presso un reparto ospedaliero sia se deceduti presso il proprio domicilio.
__label__fake Nella lingua italiana «non si dovrebbe» non significa «è vietato» o «è proibito». Infatti, il capitolo prosegue con il punto 2:
__label__fake 2- L’Autorità Giudiziaria potrà valutare, nella propria autonomia, la possibilità di limitare l’accertamento alla sola ispezione esterna del cadavere in tutti i casi in cui l’autopsia non sia strettamente necessaria. Analogamente le Direzioni sanitarie di ciascuna regione daranno indicazioni finalizzate a limitare l’esecuzione dei riscontri diagnostici ai soli casi volti alla diagnosi di causa del decesso, limitando allo stretto necessario quelli da eseguire per motivi di studio e approfondimento.
__label__fake Basta leggere questo secondo punto per comprendere che le Direzioni sanitarie possono comunque eseguire riscontri diagnostici ai soli casi volti alla diagnosi di causa del decesso. Passiamo al punto 3:
__label__fake 3- In caso di esecuzione di esame autoptico o riscontro diagnostico, oltre ad una attenta valutazione preventiva dei rischi e dei vantaggi connessi a tale procedura, devono essere adottate tutte le precauzioni seguite durante l’assistenza del malato. Le autopsie e i riscontri possono essere effettuate solo in quelle sale settorie che garantiscano condizioni di massima sicurezza e protezione infettivologica per operatori ed ambienti di lavoro: sale BSL3, ovvero con adeguato sistema di aerazione, cioè un sistema con minimo di 6 e un massimo di 12 ricambi aria per ora, pressione negativa rispetto alle aree adiacenti, e fuoriuscita di aria direttamente all’esterno della struttura stessa o attraverso filtri HEPA, se l’aria ricircola. Oltre agli indumenti protettivi e all’impiego dei DPI, l’anatomo patologo e tutto il personale presente in sala autoptica indosseranno un doppio paio di guanti in lattice, con interposto un paio di guanti antitaglio.
__label__fake Per concludere, dopo una sfilza di indicazioni riguardanti la sicurezza del personale e non solo, al punto 8 leggiamo come dovrebbe essere trattata la sala settoria al termine dell’autopsia:
__label__fake 8- Al termine dell’autopsia o del riscontro diagnostico, la sala settoria deve essere accuratamente lavata con soluzione di ipoclorito di sodio o di fenolo.
__label__fake Quindi, ancora una volta, le autopsie si possono effettuare per i morti Covid-19 a patto che vi siano le condizioni per farlo in sicurezza. Condizioni che erano già note agli addetti ai lavori, anche in merito alle difficoltà in alcune zone in cui non sono presenti sale BSL3. Ecco quanto riportato in un articolo del 10 aprile 2020:
__label__fake CATANIA – Non ci sono sale autoptiche a Catania che hanno i requisiti previsti dal ministero della Salute per poter eseguire esami sui pazienti deceduti per Covid-19. E la situazione purtroppo non è migliore nel resto del Paese. La denuncia parte dalla Società Italiana Medici Legali e Assicurativi (Simla), il cui segretario è il medico catanese Lucio Di Mauro. Una fotografia scattata con molta chiarezza dall’ente che sta pressando il ministro Speranza su due fronti: uno sull’oggettiva mancanza di tutele nei confronti dei professionisti che operano nel settore e dall’altra la necessità di dotare il sistema sanitario italiano di locali idonei a poter effettuare le autopsie.
__label__fake Corretto! Simla, la Società Italiana Medici Legali e Assicurativi, aveva denunciato attraverso il proprio sito il fatto che molte sale autoptiche non risultano essere adeguate allo svolgimento delle autopsie in sicurezza.
__label__fake Sostenere che il Ministero della Salute o il Governo vietino di effettuare le autopsie sui morti Covid-19 risulta completamente falso. Il Ministero si è limitato a fornire le indicazioni su come le autopsie andrebbero fatte in sicurezza, soprattutto di fronte a un virus che fin dagli inizi non si conosceva granché. Un altro fatto riguarda il problema degli ambienti di lavoro adatti per effettuarle, un’informazione che di fatto smentisce la narrativa del divieto.

__label__fake Open Impresa Sociale Srl
__label__fake Fondato da Enrico Mentana
__label__fake 
__label__fake Coronavirus will not affect the African continent due to the fact that Africa has a wide variety of mammals that can infect humans, but the population density is lower than in China and there are no means of quickly moving huge masses of people. In India, too, there is no coronavirus, because Indians have immunity against a conspiracy of mass hysteria.
__label__fake Conspiracy theory about the coronavirus. The first cases of coronavirus on the African continent were recorded in February in Egypt. On 3 April, an outbreak of coronavirus was recorded in Malawi, one of the last African countries which had avoided the infection until that time. As of 13 April, 14,524 confirmed cases of the disease were recorded across the continent. In India, the first coronavirus infection case was confirmed at the end of January this year. Since 25 March, a 21-day quarantine has been introduced in the country: more than a billion Indians have been banned from leaving home, except in cases of emergency. Currently, in India, 8048 cases of infection with a new strain have been recorded.
__label__fake European External Action Service (EEAS)
__label__fake Rdpt Robert Schuman 9, 1046 Brussels, Belgium
__label__fake General enquiries
__label__fake EEAS press team
__label__fake European External Action Service (EEAS)
__label__fake Rdpt Robert Schuman 9, 1046 Brussels, Belgium
__label__fake General enquiries
__label__fake EEAS press team
__label__fake Cases in the EUvsDisinfo database focus on messages in the international information space that are identified as providing a partial, distorted, or false depiction of reality and spread key pro-Kremlin messages. This does not necessarily imply, however, that a given outlet is linked to the Kremlin or editorially pro-Kremlin, or that it has intentionally sought to disinform. EUvsDisinfo publications do not represent an official EU position, as the information and opinions expressed are based on media reporting and analysis of the East Stratcom Task Force.

In India, too, there is no coronavirus, because Indians have immunity against a conspiracy of mass hysteria.
__label__fake Conspiracy theory about the coronavirus. The first cases of coronavirus on the African continent were recorded in February in Egypt. As of 13 April, 14,524 confirmed cases of the disease were recorded across the continent. In India, the first coronavirus infection case was confirmed at the end of January this year. Since 25 March, a 21-day quarantine has been introduced in the country: more than a billion Indians have been banned from leaving home, except in cases of emergency. Currently, in India, 8048 cases of infection with a new strain have been recorded.

__label__fake Coronavirus will not affect the African continent due to the fact that Africa has a wide variety of mammals that can infect humans, but the population density is lower than in China and there are no means of quickly moving huge masses of people. In India, too, there is no coronavirus, because Indians have immunity against a conspiracy of mass hysteria.
__label__fake Conspiracy theory about the coronavirus. The first cases of coronavirus on the African continent were recorded in February in Egypt. On 3 April, an outbreak of coronavirus was recorded in Malawi, one of the last African countries which had avoided the infection until that time. As of 13 April, 14,524 confirmed cases of the disease were recorded across the continent. In India, the first coronavirus infection case was confirmed at the end of January this year. Since 25 March, a 21-day quarantine has been introduced in the country: more than a billion Indians have been banned from leaving home, except in cases of emergency. Currently, in India, 8048 cases of infection with a new strain have been recorded.
__label__fake European External Action Service (EEAS)
__label__fake Rdpt Robert Schuman 9, 1046 Brussels, Belgium
__label__fake General enquiries
__label__fake EEAS press team
__label__fake European External Action Service (EEAS)
__label__fake Rdpt Robert Schuman 9, 1046 Brussels, Belgium
__label__fake General enquiries
__label__fake EEAS press team
__label__fake Cases in the EUvsDisinfo database focus on messages in the international information space that are identified as providing a partial, distorted, or false depiction of reality and spread key pro-Kremlin messages. This does not necessarily imply, however, that a given outlet is linked to the Kremlin or editorially pro-Kremlin, or that it has intentionally sought to disinform. EUvsDisinfo publications do not represent an official EU position, as the information and opinions expressed are based on media reporting and analysis of the East Stratcom Task Force.

__label__fake Cases in the EUvsDisinfo database focus on messages in the international information space that are identified as providing a partial, distorted, or false depiction of reality and spread key pro-Kremlin messages. This does not necessarily imply, however, that a given outlet is linked to the Kremlin or editorially pro-Kremlin, or that it has intentionally sought to disinform. EUvsDisinfo publications do not represent an official EU position, as the information and opinions expressed are based on media reporting and analysis of the East Stratcom Task Force.

__label__fake Your weekly update on pro-Kremlin disinformation
__label__fake 
__label__fake 
__label__fake 
__label__fake Data Protection Information *
__label__fake The Disinformation Review is sent through Mailchimp.com. See Mailchimp’s privacy policy and find out more on how EEAS protects your personal data.
__label__fake 
__label__fake I have read and understood the Privacy Statement.OK
__label__fake 
__label__fake SUBSCRIBE
__label__fake 
__label__fake 
__label__fake Coronavirus will not affect the African continent due to the fact that Africa has a wide variety of mammals that can infect humans, but the population density is lower than in China and there are no means of quickly moving huge masses of people. In India, too, there is no coronavirus, because Indians have immunity against a conspiracy of mass hysteria.
__label__fake Conspiracy theory about the coronavirus. The first cases of coronavirus on the African continent were recorded in February in Egypt. On 3 April, an outbreak of coronavirus was recorded in Malawi, one of the last African countries which had avoided the infection until that time. As of 13 April, 14,524 confirmed cases of the disease were recorded across the continent. In India, the first coronavirus infection case was confirmed at the end of January this year. Since 25 March, a 21-day quarantine has been introduced in the country: more than a billion Indians have been banned from leaving home, except in cases of emergency. Currently, in India, 8048 cases of infection with a new strain have been recorded.
__label__fake European External Action Service (EEAS)
__label__fake Rdpt Robert Schuman 9, 1046 Brussels, Belgium
__label__fake General enquiries
__label__fake EEAS press team

__label__fake لا صحة للرسالة المتداولة بعنوان “لا تلبس الكمامة اكثر من 15 دقيقة لكي لا تتسمم بثاني اكسيد الكربون”، وسبق أن أكدت منظمة الصحة العالمية أن ارتداء الكمامة لفترات طويلة قد يؤدي إلى الشعور بالضيق، لكنه لا يتسبب في التسمم بغاز ثاني أُكسيد الكربون أو نقص الأكسجين.
__label__fake هيئة مُكافَحة الإشاعات هو مشروع مستقل تم إنشاؤه عام 2012م للتصدي للإشاعات والفِتن وإحتِوائها بحيث لا تُشكل أي ضرر على المُجتمع وذلك بفضح ناشِري الأكاذيب التي تهدف إلى إثارة الرأي العام من خلال نشر الوعي وتوضيح الحقيقة بالمصادِر الرسمية.
__label__fake 
__label__fake جميع الحقوق محفوظة

__label__fake هيئة مُكافَحة الإشاعات هو مشروع مستقل تم إنشاؤه عام 2012م للتصدي للإشاعات والفِتن وإحتِوائها بحيث لا تُشكل أي ضرر على المُجتمع وذلك بفضح ناشِري الأكاذيب التي تهدف إلى إثارة الرأي العام من خلال نشر الوعي وتوضيح الحقيقة بالمصادِر الرسمية.

__label__fake لا صحة للرسالة المتداولة بعنوان “لا تلبس الكمامة اكثر من 15 دقيقة لكي لا تتسمم بثاني اكسيد الكربون”، وسبق أن أكدت منظمة الصحة العالمية أن ارتداء الكمامة لفترات طويلة قد يؤدي إلى الشعور بالضيق، لكنه لا يتسبب في التسمم بغاز ثاني أُكسيد الكربون أو نقص الأكسجين.

__label__fake جميع الحقوق محفوظة
__label__fake 2012 ©-2024                        هيئة مكافحة الإشاعات
__label__fake Le journaliste David Pujadas, le 27 août, a suggéré que le gouvernement aurait modifié ces indicateurs, afin de mieux faire passer le message d'une aggravation de la situation sanitaire.
__label__fake Le gouvernement aurait-il modifié les indicateurs du Coronavirus, afin de mieux faire passer le message d'une aggravation de la situation sanitaire ? C'est ce que suggère le journaliste David Pujadas, qui le 27 août dernier, a lancé un appel au calme sur le plateau de LCI : « On met les points sur les I, n’ayez pas peur ! Ne paniquez pas ! »
__label__fake Alors que le spectre d'une "seconde vague" de Covid agite la France, l'animateur s'appuie sur deux cartes, publiées par le gouvernement. L'une, du 27 août, montrant 21 départements en rouge, où les autorités sanitaires estiment que la circulation du virus est "active". L'autre, datée du 28 mai 2020, montrant une carte presque toute verte, où seule l’Ile-de-France et deux départements d’outre-mer (Mayotte et Guyane) sont en orange.Mais selon David Pujadas : les indicateurs utilisés par le gouvernement pour faire ces calculs auraient changé entre temps. « Si on reprend les mêmes indicateurs, on aurait exactement la même carte verte. Mais non, on nous a présenté une autre carte ».Certes le gouvernement utilise plus de critères pour fabriquer sa carte, par exemple la hausse du nombre de clusters, mais d'après les calculs de Désintox, cela n'aurait pas abouti à une carte “toute verte”, si les critères étaient restés les mêmes. En synthétisant les quatre indicateurs utilisés à cette époque (le taux d'incidence, le nombre de reproduction du virus, le taux de positivité des tests, et le taux d'occupation des lits en réanimation), cela aurait donné 4 départements en rouge (Gironde, Rhône, Var et Guyane), 84 départements en orange et 13 en vert. Une carte orange peut-être mais loin de la "carte verte" de David Pujadas.
__label__fake Retrouvez Désintox dans l'émission 28 minutes du lundi au jeudi à 20h sur Arte. Sur Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/28minutes/Sur YouTube : https://www.youtube.com/user/28minutesARTESur Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/artedesintox/Sur le site d'Arte : http://28minutes.arte.tv/

__label__fake Retrouvez aussi
__label__fake Tout France Info, et bien plus. Sauvegardez vos articles à lire plus tard et filtrer l’actualité qui vous intéresse
__label__fake A viral video accompanied by the following message has been circulating on WhatsApp.
__label__fake “Finally W.H.O. cheated the world, Corona is not a Virus, but a bacterial infection and patients can cure only in one day. See this video and make it viral send to as many as possible.”
__label__fake My Goodness is this true? Some1nd2findout. US n mny cointrirs wth strongest Intel agencies cudnt detect d fact? WHO. cheated d world?Is Corona not a Virus but a bacterial infection and patients can cure only in one day? See this video and share it so that d facts can b verified. pic.twitter.com/drXuR8uyd3
__label__fake — Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu🇮🇳 proudBhaaratheeyan🇮🇳 (@Ravichiruvolu1) June 12, 2020
__label__fake False
__label__fake There are huge structural differences between virus, bacteria and human cells as visual observation of bacteria and human cells is possible with a simple microscope, but not of a virus. Typical animal or plant cells are between 10µm to 100µm in size, bacteria are much smaller around 1µm in size, viruses are even smaller between 5nm to 300nm (see picture below). The novel coronavirus is approximately 100nm in size (Bar-On, Y et al. 2020). These structural differences between animal (including human) or plant cells and bacteria can be observed in a basic laboratory of infectious pathogens, while we need specialised equipment to visualise viruses. If the infectious germ of COVID-19 was a bacteria, it would not have remained a matter of controversy for this long.
__label__fake 
__label__fake In patients presenting with an outbreak of viral pneumonia in January 2020, the responsible pathogen (disease-causing microorganism) was initially unknown. The fluid sampled from the lungs (bronchoalveolar lavage fluid) of the patients who had been exposed to the seafood market in Wuhan were obtained. They had tested negative for commonly known respiratory tract pathogens.
__label__fake These samples were cultured, and genome sequencing was done. Genome sequencing is a process of finding out the order of DNA nucleotides, or bases, in all the genes—the order of As, Cs, Gs, and Ts that make up an organism’s genome. The genome sequences of those samples were remarkably similar (not the same) to a previously identified virus which had caused two outbreaks in the past. This new organism was thus identified as a new coronavirus and named SARS-CoV-2. The same virus (SARS-CoV-2) has since been found during the contact tracing for the infected individuals via RT-PCR test – the COVID-19 test conducted in the hospitals on suspected people.
__label__fake Later, CDC, USA also released a schematic diagram of the virus structure (see below) to suggest the mechanism by which the virus enters the human cells. A protein on the surface of the virus (s protein) was found to be attached to a specific receptor (ACE2) on the surface of the human cell to gain entry and multiply inside the human cells (Xu, X et al 2020).
__label__fake 
__label__fake Therefore, evidence from tissue samples of patients, epidemiological data, clinical data, genomic data all conclusively establish that the current pandemic named COVID-19 is caused by a novel coronavirus and not by a bacterium.
__label__fake About 5–15% of patients with COVID-19 infection require intensive care surveillance and ventilatory support (Möhlenkamp, S et al. 2020). This is primarily because of the effects of pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome on the ability of the patient to maintain respiration on their own. Other manifestations of COVID-19 like Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC), acute pulmonary embolism, deep-vein thrombosis, ischemic stroke, myocardial infarction etc., usually require ICU support (Klok, F.A et al. 2020). Many of the difficulties of thromboembolism (dislodgement of multiple small clots from a more massive lump) or DIC require mechanical ventilation.
__label__fake Therefore, it is not true that COVID-19 patients never require ventilator and ICU support.
__label__fake The mean time between the onset of the disease to the recovery of COVID-19 patients is 24.7 days (Verity R et al. 2020), see figure below. Therefore, it is not true that COVID-19 can be cured in a day.
__label__fake There is an ample amount of evidence that the current pandemic is caused by a novel coronavirus named SARS-CoV-2. It is absurd to assert that the nature of the microbe causing the epidemic and its cure, can all be kept hidden from the world. While COVID-19 deniers have various motives to spread conspiracy theories, it is the knowledge and communication gap between experts and the masses, and lack of trust in authorities that allow these theories to thrive despite easily available evidence to the contrary. While a viral video claiming that COVID-19 never requires ventilatory and ICU support and can be cured in a day would sound reassuring to people, this is not true.
__label__fake Severe COVID-19 cases can only be managed with intensive care like organ support interventions. These conspiracy theories only make the situation worse as they encourage complacency and non-adherence to social distancing, rigorous hand-washing and use of masks.
__label__fake References
__label__fake Lu, R., Zhao, X., Li, J., Niu, P., Yang, B., Wu, H., … & Bi, Y. (2020). Genomic characterisation and epidemiology of 2019 novel coronavirus: implications for virus origins and receptor binding. The Lancet, 395(10224), 565-574.
__label__fake Möhlenkamp, S., & Thiele, H. (2020). Ventilation of COVID-19 patients in intensive care units. Herz, 1.
__label__fake Verity, R., Okell, L., Dorigatti, I., Winskill, P., Whittaker, C., & Imai, N. et al. (2020). Estimates of the severity of coronavirus disease 2019: a model-based analysis. The Lancet Infectious Diseases, 20(6), 669-677.
__label__fake Klok, F. A., Kruip, M. J. H. A., Van der Meer, N. J. M., Arbous, M. S., Gommers, D. A. M. P. J., Kant, K. M., … & Endeman, H. (2020). Incidence of thrombotic complications in critically ill ICU patients with COVID-19. Thrombosis research.
__label__fake Xu, X., Chen, P., Wang, J., Feng, J., Zhou, H., Li, X., … & Hao, P. (2020). Evolution of the novel coronavirus from the ongoing Wuhan outbreak and modelling of its spike protein for risk of human transmission. Science China Life Sciences, 63(3), 457-460.
__label__fake Donate Now
__label__fake Dr Sharfaroz Satani is a science writer for Alt News Science and a drug safety physician. He advocates for evidence-based medicine, freethought, and social equality. He also writes satire, poetry and fiction.
__label__fake A video of a ladder moving on its own, purportedly from Jharkhand, is viral on…
__label__fake In a 2-minute video, a man recommends a “technique” to prevent infection from Omicron, the…
__label__fake A video of a set of iron nails that appear to melt after being placed…
__label__fake Several social media users have shared an image that shows two columns — ‘Cepa/variante’ (Spanish…
__label__fake A 90-second video of a man dissecting a banana has been shared on the internet….
__label__fake A viral video accompanied by the following message has been circulating on WhatsApp.
__label__fake “Finally W.H.O. cheated the world, Corona is not a Virus, but a bacterial infection and patients can cure only in one day. See this video and make it viral send to as many as possible.”
__label__fake My Goodness is this true? Some1nd2findout. US n mny cointrirs wth strongest Intel agencies cudnt detect d fact? WHO. cheated d world?Is Corona not a Virus but a bacterial infection and patients can cure only in one day? See this video and share it so that d facts can b verified. pic.twitter.com/drXuR8uyd3
__label__fake — Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu🇮🇳 proudBhaaratheeyan🇮🇳 (@Ravichiruvolu1) June 12, 2020
__label__fake False
__label__fake There are huge structural differences between virus, bacteria and human cells as visual observation of bacteria and human cells is possible with a simple microscope, but not of a virus. Typical animal or plant cells are between 10µm to 100µm in size, bacteria are much smaller around 1µm in size, viruses are even smaller between 5nm to 300nm (see picture below). The novel coronavirus is approximately 100nm in size (Bar-On, Y et al. 2020). These structural differences between animal (including human) or plant cells and bacteria can be observed in a basic laboratory of infectious pathogens, while we need specialised equipment to visualise viruses. If the infectious germ of COVID-19 was a bacteria, it would not have remained a matter of controversy for this long.
__label__fake 
__label__fake In patients presenting with an outbreak of viral pneumonia in January 2020, the responsible pathogen (disease-causing microorganism) was initially unknown. The fluid sampled from the lungs (bronchoalveolar lavage fluid) of the patients who had been exposed to the seafood market in Wuhan were obtained. They had tested negative for commonly known respiratory tract pathogens.
__label__fake These samples were cultured, and genome sequencing was done. Genome sequencing is a process of finding out the order of DNA nucleotides, or bases, in all the genes—the order of As, Cs, Gs, and Ts that make up an organism’s genome. The genome sequences of those samples were remarkably similar (not the same) to a previously identified virus which had caused two outbreaks in the past. This new organism was thus identified as a new coronavirus and named SARS-CoV-2. The same virus (SARS-CoV-2) has since been found during the contact tracing for the infected individuals via RT-PCR test – the COVID-19 test conducted in the hospitals on suspected people.
__label__fake Later, CDC, USA also released a schematic diagram of the virus structure (see below) to suggest the mechanism by which the virus enters the human cells. A protein on the surface of the virus (s protein) was found to be attached to a specific receptor (ACE2) on the surface of the human cell to gain entry and multiply inside the human cells (Xu, X et al 2020).
__label__fake 
__label__fake Therefore, evidence from tissue samples of patients, epidemiological data, clinical data, genomic data all conclusively establish that the current pandemic named COVID-19 is caused by a novel coronavirus and not by a bacterium.
__label__fake About 5–15% of patients with COVID-19 infection require intensive care surveillance and ventilatory support (Möhlenkamp, S et al. 2020). This is primarily because of the effects of pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome on the ability of the patient to maintain respiration on their own. Other manifestations of COVID-19 like Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC), acute pulmonary embolism, deep-vein thrombosis, ischemic stroke, myocardial infarction etc., usually require ICU support (Klok, F.A et al. 2020). Many of the difficulties of thromboembolism (dislodgement of multiple small clots from a more massive lump) or DIC require mechanical ventilation.
__label__fake Therefore, it is not true that COVID-19 patients never require ventilator and ICU support.
__label__fake The mean time between the onset of the disease to the recovery of COVID-19 patients is 24.7 days (Verity R et al. 2020), see figure below. Therefore, it is not true that COVID-19 can be cured in a day.
__label__fake There is an ample amount of evidence that the current pandemic is caused by a novel coronavirus named SARS-CoV-2. It is absurd to assert that the nature of the microbe causing the epidemic and its cure, can all be kept hidden from the world. While COVID-19 deniers have various motives to spread conspiracy theories, it is the knowledge and communication gap between experts and the masses, and lack of trust in authorities that allow these theories to thrive despite easily available evidence to the contrary. While a viral video claiming that COVID-19 never requires ventilatory and ICU support and can be cured in a day would sound reassuring to people, this is not true.
__label__fake Severe COVID-19 cases can only be managed with intensive care like organ support interventions. These conspiracy theories only make the situation worse as they encourage complacency and non-adherence to social distancing, rigorous hand-washing and use of masks.
__label__fake References
__label__fake Lu, R., Zhao, X., Li, J., Niu, P., Yang, B., Wu, H., … & Bi, Y. (2020). Genomic characterisation and epidemiology of 2019 novel coronavirus: implications for virus origins and receptor binding. The Lancet, 395(10224), 565-574.
__label__fake Möhlenkamp, S., & Thiele, H. (2020). Ventilation of COVID-19 patients in intensive care units. Herz, 1.
__label__fake Verity, R., Okell, L., Dorigatti, I., Winskill, P., Whittaker, C., & Imai, N. et al. (2020). Estimates of the severity of coronavirus disease 2019: a model-based analysis. The Lancet Infectious Diseases, 20(6), 669-677.
__label__fake Klok, F. A., Kruip, M. J. H. A., Van der Meer, N. J. M., Arbous, M. S., Gommers, D. A. M. P. J., Kant, K. M., … & Endeman, H. (2020). Incidence of thrombotic complications in critically ill ICU patients with COVID-19. Thrombosis research.
__label__fake Xu, X., Chen, P., Wang, J., Feng, J., Zhou, H., Li, X., … & Hao, P. (2020). Evolution of the novel coronavirus from the ongoing Wuhan outbreak and modelling of its spike protein for risk of human transmission. Science China Life Sciences, 63(3), 457-460.
__label__fake Donate Now

__label__fake PUBLICIDADE
__label__fake 
__label__fake Leia a versão em espanhol
__label__fake PUBLICIDADE
__label__fake Ainda não existe uma vacina contra o novo coronavírus. Publicações nas redes sociais afirmam que Cuba já desenvolveu a imunização contra o vírus, o que é falso. Na verdade, o governo cubano firmou uma parceria com a China para tratar pacientes do covid-19 com o medicamento interferon alfa 2B. De acordo com o Granma, jornal oficial da ilha, o remédio obteve resultados positivos na cura de 1.500 pacientes chineses.
__label__fake O interferon alfa 2B não é um medicamento novo. De acordo com a Fiocruz, ele tem sido usado em pacientes de hepatite B, hepatite C, leucemia e outros.
__label__fake Interferon alfa 2B
__label__fake A Organização Mundial da Saúde (OMS) indica que ainda não existem medicamentos ou terapias comprovadamente capazes de evitar a infecção pelo novo coronavírus. A entidade informa que o vírus é tão novo e diferente que precisa de uma vacina própria. As imunizações contra pneumonia e gripe não oferecem proteção contra o SARS-Cov-2. Até agora, a forma mais eficaz de se proteger é com medidas de higiene simples, como higienizar as mãos com água e sabão ou álcool em gel.
__label__fake 
__label__fake A OMS tem apoiado cientistas que estão pesquisando opções de vacina. No entanto, ainda não há previsão de quando elas podem ser liberadas para o público. De acordo com o Instituto Butantan, "o processo de pesquisa e desenvolvimento de uma nova vacina é constituído de diversas etapas, tratando-se, portanto, de um processo demorado, de alto investimento e associado a riscos elevados".
__label__fake A primeira etapa de desenvolvimento de uma vacina é de pesquisa básica; depois, são realizados estudos pré-clínicos (sem pessoas). Só então a imunização é testada em seres humanos e, após um longo processo, pode ser disponibilizada para a população.
__label__fake Publicidade
__label__fake O Estadão Verifica também entrou em contato com a BioFarmaCuba, empresa citada como responsável pelo desenvolvimento da vacina na ilha. Não obtivemos resposta até a publicação desta checagem.
__label__fake O E-Farsas também checou esse boato.
__label__fake Este boato foi checado por aparecer entre os principais conteúdos suspeitos que circulam no Facebook. O Estadão Verifica tem acesso a uma lista de postagens potencialmente falsas e a dados sobre sua viralização em razão de uma parceria com a rede social. Quando nossas verificações constatam que uma informação é enganosa, o Facebook reduz o alcance de sua circulação. Usuários da rede social e administradores de páginas recebem notificações se tiverem publicado ou compartilhado postagens marcadas como falsas. Um aviso também é enviado a quem quiser postar um conteúdo que tiver sido sinalizado como inverídico anteriormente.
__label__fake Um pré-requisito para participar da parceria com o Facebook  é obter certificação da International Fact Checking Network (IFCN), o que, no caso do Estadão Verifica, ocorreu em janeiro de 2019. A associação internacional de verificadores de fatos exige das entidades certificadas que assinem um código de princípios e assumam compromissos em cinco áreas:  apartidarismo e imparcialidade; transparência das fontes; transparência do financiamento e organização; transparência da metodologia; e política de correções aberta e honesta. O comprometimento com essas práticas promove mais equilíbrio e precisão no trabalho.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Texto traduzido pelo LatamChequea, grupo colaborativo que reúne dezenas de fact-checkers da América Latina no combate à desinformação relacionada ao novo coronavírus.
__label__fake 
__label__fake Publicidade
__label__fake Aún no existe una vacuna contra el nuevo coronavirus. Publicaciones en las redes sociales afirman que Cuba ya desarrolló la inmunización contra el virus, afirmación que es falsa. En realidad, el gobierno cubano firmó una alianza con China para tratar pacientes con Covid-19 con el medicamento interferón alfa 2B. Según Granma, periódico oficial de la isla, el remedio obtuvo resultados positivos en la cura de 1500 pacientes chinos.
__label__fake El interferón alfa 2B no es un medicamento nuevo. De acuerdo con la Fundación Fiocruz, el mismo fue utilizado en pacientes con hepatitis B, hepatitis C, leucemia y otros.
__label__fake Interferón alfa 2B
__label__fake La Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) señala que aún no existen medicamentos o terapias capaces de evitar la infección por el nuevo coronavirus. La entidad informa que el virus es tan nuevo y diferente que necesita una vacuna propia. Las inmunizaciones contra la neumonía y la gripe no ofrecen protección contra el SARS-CoV-2. Hasta el momento, la forma más eficaz de protegerse es con medidas de higiene simples, como higienizarse las manos con agua y jabón o con alcohol en gel.
__label__fake La OMS está apoyando a científicos que investigan opciones de una vacuna. Sin embargo, todavía no existe previsión respecto de cuándo las vacunas podrán estar disponibles para el público. Según el Instituto Butantan, "el proceso de investigación y desarrollo de una nueva vacuna se compone de diversas etapas tratándose, por lo tanto, de un proceso largo, con una alta inversión y asociado a riesgos elevados".
__label__fake La primera etapa de desarrollo de una vacuna es de investigación básica; posteriormente se realizan estudios pre-clínicos (sin personas). Solo entonces se prueba la inmunización en seres humanos y, luego de un largo proceso, puede estar disponible para la población.
__label__fake Estadão Verifica además contactó a BioFarmaCuba, empresa citada como responsable del desarrollo de la vacuna en la isla. Hasta la publicación de esta verificación, no obtuvimos respuesta.
__label__fake Publicidade
__label__fake E-Farsas también chequeó este rumor.
__label__fake Os comentários são exclusivos para assinantes do Estadão.
__label__fake Institucional
__label__fake Atendimento
__label__fake Conexão Estadão
__label__fake Hoje
__label__fake Copyright © 1995 - 2024 Grupo Estado
__label__fake Copyright © 1995 - 2024 Grupo Estado
__label__fake PUBLICIDADE
